name: orchestra-plugin
description: A multi-agent orchestration layer for Claude Code. Coordinates specialized subagents (UI, API, Data, Integration, QA, etc.) using declarative skill and policy mappings.
author: Tsutomu Morishita
tagline: Make your AI agents work like an orchestra — precise, autonomous, and collaborative.

commands.name: browser
commands.description: Start/restart the Browser MCP server for automated web operations

documentation.summary: This plugin extends Claude Code into a semi-autonomous multi-agent environment.
usage: Alex acts as the central project conductor, routing tasks to subagents based on triggers.
Subagents (e.g., Kai, Mina, Finn) invoke skills automatically according to conditions defined in skills-map.yaml.
Core skills provide shared principles for code quality, security, QA, and documentation.
Mode skills specialize by context (UI, API, DB, etc.) and inherit from core skill templates.

examples.user: I need to fix a slow API endpoint.
examples.assistant: Alex invokes Kai (architect) and Skye (implementer). Kai ensures contract/performance alignment; Skye applies coding standards and triggers QA before merge.

examples.user: We’re preparing a new Shopify integration rollout.
examples.assistant: Alex routes to Mina (integrator) using integration and security skills. Blake (release) manages staging→prod rollout with rollback policy.
